about.intro: I am a full-stack developer with two years of experience, primarily focused on front-end development using React and TypeScript. On the back end, I have worked with Java Spring Boot to design APIs and integrate databases, building stable and scalable services. I also have hands-on experience in cloud and automation, having designed CI/CD pipelines and set up deployment environments using AWS services and Docker.

ponylink.title: Full Stack Developer @ Ponylink
ponylink.subtitle: Onsite | October 2023 - August 2025
ponylink.desc:
‚Ä¢ Frontend: Built responsive web applications using React, Next.js, and TypeScript, focusing on usability, performance, and maintainable code.
‚Ä¢ Backend: Developed and maintained backend services with Kotlin (Spring Boot) and Java, including API integrations, microservices, and CI/CD pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Cloud & DevOps: Managed deployments and infrastructure on AWS (EC2, EKS, S3) and implemented automated pipelines using Jenkins.
                  ‚Ä¢ Prototyping & Internal Projects: Led and contributed to prototypes, including a real-time vehicle maintenance service (WebRTC/AWS Chime) and a microservices demo (RabbitMQ, Spring Gateway).

‚Ä¢ Strengthened expertise in database design, normalization, and SQL optimization

eip.title: Engineer of Information Processing
eip.desc:
‚Ä¢ A nationally accredited certification issued by the Human Resources Development Service of Korea (HRD Korea).
‚Ä¢ Covers a wide range of computer science domains, including software engineering, databases, operating systems, and computer networks.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrates the ability to apply fundamental computer science knowledge to practical development environments.
‚Ä¢ This certification provides a strong foundation for systematic software development practices and enhances professional credibility as a developer.

linux.title: Linux Master (Level 2)
linux.desc:
‚Ä¢ A certification issued by the Korea Association for ICT Promotion(KAIT), focused on fundamental Linux administration skills.
‚Ä¢ Learned essential topics such as Linux installation and configuration, user and permission management, process control, and basic shell scripting.
‚Ä¢ Strengthened the ability to manage and maintain secure and efficient Linux server environments, serving as a strong foundation for backend and cloud infrastructure operations.

acs.title: Coupang Digital VI System ‚Äì Apple Care Service (ACS)
acs.desc:
ACS (Apple Care Service) is a service that allows customers who purchase Apple devices on Coupang to pay for the existing one-time insurance product, Apple Care+, through a monthly subscription plan.
This reduces the initial cost burden and aims to attract more customers.
The service architecture is designed to be expandable beyond Apple Care+, enabling support for other device warranty and insurance products in the future.
features: Digital product subscription management and term-based subscription tracking
Registration and modification of payment methods for subscriptions
Subscription cancellation and withdrawal processes
Subscription status management via the admin page
Multi-platform support: PC/Mobile Web, WebView
Development and operation of API, interface, and batch processes
role: Frontend Development: Implemented PC/Mobile Web and WebView UI (Next.js, React)

BFF Server Maintenance & Testing: Conducted stability testing, bug fixes, issue resolution for external/internal service integrations, and performance monitoring of the existing Kotlin-based API server
Operations/Deployment: Built monitoring environment (Grafana) and handled incident response
Performance Optimization: Improved response times through caching and query optimization

crewcall.title: LG U+ CrewCall (Group Call)
crewcall.desc: A group calling app pre-installed on LG U+ smartphones, supporting up to 10 simultaneous participants and favorite group management for quick calls. In this project, I contributed to WebView backend development (Spring Boot, Java), implementation of authentication, terms agreement, and settings features, as well as CI/CD and deployment automation.
features: Group calls with up to 10 participants
Favorite group management and quick call initiation
WebView-based experience within the mobile app
User experience optimized for quick group calling
role: Developed and implemented WebView backend (Spring Boot, Java) and UI
Operated CI/CD pipelines and managed deployment processes
Monitored and maintained service operation environments (K8s, Docker)
contributions: Developed WebView backend (Spring Boot, Java): Implemented MVC architecture and rendered UI using Thymeleaf templates
Managed CI/CD pipeline: Configured AWS-based automated build, test, and Docker deployment; monitored deployment status and handled rollback processes
Implemented SMS authentication: Added phone number verification and authentication code generation/verification in the onboarding flow
Terms & Policy Management: Delivered terms content dynamically via S3‚ÄìCloudFront, implemented user consent validation logic, and integrated UI controls
Logging & Analytics Instrumentation: Integrated with LG U+ internal logging system, collected and analyzed app entry, active user counts, and group call usage statistics
K8s & Docker Operations: Managed container configurations, monitored runtime status, and responded to incidents

techSupport.title: Real-time Automobile Tech Support Platform (Prototype)
techSupport.desc: A prototype platform that enables workers in automobile maintenance sites to receive remote technical support through real-time video, audio, and chat. The system leverages AWS Chime (WebRTC) for live communication, Redis and PostgreSQL for session/matching management, and SSE for instant notifications to deliver a stable and interactive support experience.
features: One-time login using nickname with session-based authentication
1:1 automatic worker-supporter matching (FIFO queue based)
Real-time video/audio/text chat via AWS Chime (WebRTC, Data Channel)
Connection/session management using Redis with TTL-based auto-cleanup
Persistent user, meeting, and matching data stored in PostgreSQL
Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time request, acceptance, and termination notifications
Jenkins pipeline for automated deployment of Spring Boot REST APIs
role: Frontend Development: Developed React/TypeScript-based UI and API integrations
Backend Development: Implemented Spring Boot REST APIs, AWS Chime integration, and SSE notification flow
Infrastructure: Designed PostgreSQL schema and created Jenkins CI/CD pipeline
contributions: Designed and implemented Spring Boot REST APIs and integrated AWS Chime SDK to provide real-time video, audio, and text chat
Implemented termination flow with AWS DeleteMeeting API and DB cleanup logic to prevent unnecessary billing
Designed PostgreSQL schema and implemented matching/meeting data management logic
Built Jenkins pipeline to enable automated build, test, and deployment of the backend application
Developed basic React/TypeScript UI for login, support request, and meeting room, and integrated with backend APIs

sensorDashboard.title: Real-time Multi-modal Sensor Data Analytics Dashboard
sensorDashboard.desc: A full-stack analytics platform designed to efficiently query and visualize large-scale multi-modal sensor data stored in PostgreSQL. The system ensures high data reliability through Python-based preprocessing and features a scalable infrastructure managed as code with Terraform on GCP.
features: Node-specific Data Filtering: Allows users to select specific Node IDs to isolate and visualize data from individual sensor devices.
Customizable Time-range Queries: Features 'Quick Selection' buttons for preset intervals (Today, last 7 days, etc.) along with manual date-range pickers for flexible data exploration.
Sensor Value Range Search: Provides granular filtering capabilities by allowing users to define specific value ranges for metrics such as temperature, humidity, and illumination.
Multi-modal Data Visualization: Presents diverse sensor categories through intuitive charts and synchronized data tables for comprehensive monitoring.
Automated Data Preprocessing: Utilizes Python (Pandas) to normalize Node IDs and clean raw sensor records for consistent database integrity.
Secure Infrastructure Management: Implements Nginx reverse proxy with SSL encryption and domain-restricted CORS policies for safe cross-origin data communication.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Managed GCP resources including VM instances and firewall rules using Terraform for reproducible environments.
role: Full-stack Development: Designed and implemented the RESTful API for complex data querying and the responsive dashboard UI.
DevOps & Infrastructure: Built and managed the automated deployment pipeline using Docker Compose, GitHub Actions, and Docker Hub.
Cloud Infrastructure Engineer: Provisioned and orchestrated cloud resources using Terraform to ensure infrastructure consistency.
contributions: Architected efficient SQL queries and Express.js API endpoints to handle multi-conditional filtering (Node ID, time range, and sensor value ranges).
Enhanced user experience (UX) by implementing 'Quick Range' shortcut buttons for frequently used time intervals.
Developed a high-performance visualization dashboard using Next.js and TypeScript that reacts instantly to complex filter changes.
Provisioned GCP Compute Engine and network security groups via Terraform, eliminating manual configuration errors and ensuring 100% reproducibility.
Strengthened system security by refactoring CORS settings to restrict API access exclusively to the production domain via environment variables.
Integrated Certbot within a Docker container to automate SSL certificate issuance and 90-day renewal cycles.
troubleshooting: Optimized database query performance for large datasets by implementing efficient indexing strategies and server-side filtering logic.
Resolved 'Mixed Content' and CORS blockers by configuring an Nginx reverse proxy to unify frontend and backend under a single SSL-secured domain.
Eliminated synchronization issues between the build image and production server by establishing a 'Pull-based' deployment flow via Docker Hub.

approvalWeb.title: Internal Electronic Approval Web System
approvalWeb.desc: Extended the existing app-based electronic approval system to the web. Implemented document review and approval/rejection, attachment handling, leave applications, and user settings. Leveraged existing Java REST APIs, and developed the entire frontend solo using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
features: View approval documents and approve/reject
Upload and download document images and attachments
Register and view comments on approval documents
Submit leave applications, view status, and check remaining leave
User settings: password change, delegate designation, e-signature registration/update
Change email and app push notification preferences
role: Frontend Development: Solo development of UI and logic using React (Next.js) + TypeScript
API Integration: Integrated with existing Java REST APIs for data communication
UX: Built user-friendly flows for attachments preview/upload and e-signature input
contributions: Independently developed the web UI using Next.js and TypeScript
Integrated with Java REST APIs (documents/leave/settings) with error/loading handling
Implemented approval flows (approve/reject) and comments features
Implemented attachments upload/preview/download
Built leave application/status/remaining balance views
Developed user settings pages (password, delegate, e-signature, notifications)

wishlist.title: Wishlist Collage Web App
wishlist.desc: A simple yet creative web application that allows users to add images and links of desired items, automatically remove their backgrounds, and generate a clean collage-style wishlist. Built with a FastAPI backend and React (Next.js) frontend, fully deployed using AWS (EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFront) and Vercel.
features: Add desired items with images and links
Automatic background removal using Python `rembg` library
Upload and store processed images on AWS S3
Store and manage item metadata in AWS RDS (PostgreSQL)
View wishlist images through CloudFront for optimized delivery
Responsive design for both PC and mobile
role: Backend Development: Built and deployed a FastAPI backend server on AWS EC2 using Docker
Database Design: Configured AWS RDS (PostgreSQL) to store item data and image metadata
Frontend Development: Developed responsive web UI with React (Next.js)
Cloud Integration: Configured AWS S3, CloudFront, and RDS for seamless backend integration
DevOps: Managed EC2 instance setup, Docker containerization, and Vercel deployment
contributions: Developed Python backend server using FastAPI for image background removal, metadata handling, and S3 integration
Integrated `rembg` for background removal and optimized image size processing to improve EC2 memory efficiency
Designed and implemented PostgreSQL schema in AWS RDS to manage wishlist items and image references
Implemented S3 upload logic and CloudFront-based retrieval for fast image delivery
Designed frontend wishlist interface and collage layout using Next.js
Set up Dockerized backend deployment on EC2 and configured CORS / proxy settings for stable API communication
Performed responsive UI testing on desktop and mobile devices
troubleshooting: Fixed Out-of-Memory errors on EC2 caused by large image processing ‚Äî optimized `rembg` usage and upgraded EC2 memory to 2GB
Resolved mixed-content API errors (HTTPS frontend / HTTP backend) by configuring Next.js API proxy for secure communication
Handled database connection pooling for AWS RDS to ensure stable performance under concurrent requests
